headline: Trumps goal is to solidify control over the GOP, not help it win elections | Column
sentences:
I have Donald Trump tattooed on my rear end. "
Cruzs remarks invited mockery, given that he battled Trump for the GOP presidential nomination in 2016 all the way to the convention and then pledged his love for Trump  despite the fact that Trump had insulted Cruzs wife, suggested Cruzs father was linked to John F. Kennedys assassination and claimed Cruz stole the Iowa caucuses.

Besides memory-holing his own Trump sycophancy, the other strange note in Cruzs performance was his claim that the establishment? is still run by moderate Republican squishes.? The reality is that to the extent there is an establishment?  everyone from nationalist donors like Peter Thiel to the Heritage Foundation to Fox News  its mostly MAGA.

Trumps revolution within the GOP succeeded, but as Jacques Mallet du Pan wrote in 1793 about the chaos in France, Like Saturn, the Revolution devours its children.?
Jonah Goldberg is editor-in-chief of The Dispatch and the host of The Remnant podcast.

House Republicans completed their transition to full MAGA when they defenestrated Rep. Liz Cheney and replaced her with Rep. Elise Stefanik, who has transformed herself from a thoughtful Republican moderate into little more than a Twitter troll.

As Fred Bauer notes in National Review, Trump has been more focused on asserting dominance over the GOP than ensuring that Republicans win elections.?
The irony is that Trump is now grappling with the woes of being the establishment.
And while his agenda looks nothing like a normal establishment agenda, he still has to contend with politicians with their own ambitions, and theyre giving Trump a taste of his own medicine.
Sen. Ted Cruz of Texas said something interesting while campaigning for Dave McCormick, one of the contenders for the GOP nomination to replace departing Sen. Pat Toomey of Pennsylvania.
The key to understanding the GOP primaries is to understand that neither traditional conservative ideology nor even competence are qualifications or differentiators anymore.
The key to understanding the GOP primaries is to understand that neither traditional conservative ideology nor even competence are qualifications or differentiators anymore.
If they were, Liz Cheney wouldnt be a pariah, and the bomb-throwing Reps. Marjorie Taylor Greene and Lauren Boebert wouldnt be Republican stars.
In Ohio, Josh Mandel lost his bid for the GOP senate nomination  and for Trumps endorsement  despite running as the Renfield to Trumps Dracula.
In the final days of the Pennsylvania primary, Kathy Barnette, a GOP Senate candidate, took to attacking the swamp? in true Trumpian fashion.
Of course, none of Trumps criteria for endorsements have anything to do with ideological or even partisan litmus tests.
Its true that Senate Republican leader Mitch McConnell has no love for Trump, but hes neither a moderate nor a squish.
Just once, Id love to see a Republican candidate stand up in a primary and say: I am a moderate, establishment squish.
Trump will have more wins and losses in this primary season, but the larger lesson is clear: The die has been cast.
And, if they check those boxes, they need to have a better-than-good chance of winning  without his endorsement.
McCormick surrounded himself with former Trump aides, who apparently didnt mind working against their old boss.
It was President Trump who shifted and aligned with our values.? Translation: MAGA is bigger than Trump now.
Its true that, with very few exceptions, Republican primary candidates do pledge their love for Trump.
Cruz was perfectly happy to campaign for McCormick against Trumps endorsed candidate, Dr. Mehmet Oz.
Although he coined the word, MAGA actually belongs to the people,? Barnette said in a recent debate.
People like Fox News Sean Hannity, who has carried more water for Trump than a thousand Gunga Dins.
But nobody says that.? He then added, And by the way, they all pledge their love for Donald Trump.
(Hes also said he would vote for Trump if he is the partys presidential nominee in 2024.)
They also must subscribe to his bogus claim that the 2020 election was stolen from him.
Everyone has to be an angry populist revolutionary who wants to see the world burn.
Trumps real goal isnt to expand the party but to solidify his control of it.
Ron DeSantis started out as a student of Trumpism and is now a MAGA master.
Trump wants to pick winners, so he can take credit for being a kingmaker.
I stand for absolutely nothing. It would be refreshingly honest at least.
Theres no point sitting around pondering Cruzs lack of self-awareness.
Some are more obsequious and shameless than others, of course.
Candidates seeking his endorsement must praise him lavishly.
Our values never, never shifted to President Trumps values.
Josh Mandel didnt stop campaigning when Trump rebuffed him.
But who are the swamp creatures, according to Barnette?
I love Donald Trump more. No, no, no.
His Twitter handle is @JonahDispatch.

But he did make a good point.
I love Donald Trump. No, no.
